body: Alejandro Tarre in Caracas Chronicles writes about February 14th 1936: "In my view, February 14th 1936 was the initial spark that marked a process of democratization without precedent in our history. Democracy might not have “flowered” that day, but it did begin to gain ground against an authoritarian inheritance of many centuries."
original_body: Alejandro Tarre in Caracas Chronicles writes about February 14th 1936: "In my view, February 14th 1936 was the initial spark that marked a process of democratization without precedent in our history. Democracy might not have “flowered” that day, but it did begin to gain ground against an authoritarian inheritance of many centuries."
title: Venezuela: Remembering a Historic February 14

sentence: Alejandro Tarre in Caracas Chronicles writes about February 14th 1936: "In my view, February 14th 1936 was the initial spark that marked a process of democratization without precedent in our history.
Democracy might not have “flowered” that day, but it did begin to gain ground against an authoritarian inheritance of many centuries."
